runs.comm: wide of the off stump and left alone - touch of swing away from the right-hander
a little too wide once more, but Bopara leaves it well alone
smashed over point for four! Short, wide and given the treatment

nudges a single to the off side - this'll be tight. Good grief, get a move on Bopara - he dives in but Afridi's throw hits the stumps! It's touch and go - the boos around the ground confirm that it's not-out
good, sharp delivery which lifts and leaves the right-hander's off stump. He plays and misses...
short, wide and flayed in front of square on the back foot. He's timed that brilliantly, Wright. Plenty of pace in this pitch, and an excellent outfield
well wide of the off stump and left alone
superb catch by Shoaib Malik at backward point! Bopara drove on the up, it took a thick outside edge and Malik dived to his left to cling onto a very fine chance
on his legs, clipped to midwicket
drives and gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
plonks it out to the off side and he sets off for an Achilles-testing run. Looks fine, too.
87mph, short and punched out to the off side
hammered to mid-off! Timed the cover off that, KP, and the crowd acknowledge the safe stop with thumping applause
steals a quick run to mid-on and Saeed fumbles, which receives ironic jeers from the English contingent in the crowd.
good line and length, Wright punches to cover
steps across to the off side and pats this through midwicket for two, scattering a load of pigeons
he's timed that - but straight to Afridi at cover. Afridi is going berserk out there, clapping and applauding like mad. He's completely up for it
cheers greet Wright who flicks one for four past the short fine-leg
steps down the pitch and slaps it impetuously, aggressively to mid-on
pushed out to the off side
shorter ball, Wright steps to leg and tries to slap him over the keeper and slip but misses
Wright steps to leg and smacks this into Mars - it's gone miles in the air, but is it safe? It's high, high, high over long-on and beats his chase
bang! That's more like it, England. A thumping pull over midwicket - flat for six, and England's first of the tournament
four more - full toss outside off and it gets a thick bottom edge which beats Akmal's dive
bashed back to the bowler who fields in his follow-through, and thousands of Pakistan fans all appeal. Bump ball, though
pushes for one to cover. No sign of his Achilles problem. Ahem...
bosh! Wright's on form here - too short and straight and he pulls it with a short-arm jab, muscularly through midwicket

carved down to third man - woops! Comical from Umar Gul who lets it through his legs. Gul strokes his chin, wondering how on earth he missed the ball, before laughing hysterically. The bowler, however, finds it rather less amusing
pushed out to the off side
a high full toss slapped over mid-on for four. Really difficult shot to time, but Pietersen did well there
big, massive - monstrous! He slaps it over the top into the old radio commentary boxes by the pavilion, hammering off the reddened brickwork. 104 metres of meaty goodness. Terrific strike!
on his legs, Wright nudges for a single
a no-ball full toss smashed down the ground
sliced to cover - who misfields! Oh dear, that's a howler from Ahmed Shehzad
bowled him! The roof's coming off at The Oval now! A yorker sends Wright's stumps shattering and Gul goes into orbit to celebrate
a bouncer down the leg side and eventually wided, to the hilariously ironic cheers of England's fans
pushed defensively out to mid-off
back cut to point. Good field to counter Shah's square-of-the-wicket play
great yorker, it really is. Right up there - Shah had to dig it out with a shovel
and he starts with a wide down the leg side
oh he's hit that sweetly. Tossed up outside off, Pietersen sweeps him through square leg with power. Lovely crunchy noise of ball on bat
a little straighter and nurdled around the corner
beats him outside off
full toss banged over long-off for four. Top shot
driven out to the off side
down the pitch and mistimes it, aerially, to a deepish mid-on
driven to long-off. No spin on offer yet
starts with a full toss which is stroked to long-off
quicker ball on his legs, Shah flicks
smashed straight back to Afridi who, somehow, doesn't break a finger in attempting to field it. Ouch
nurdled for a single
goes for a huge smash and gets an inside edge - excellent quicker ball
turned to leg for another single
flicked to leg for another jogged two
a touch quicker and nudged to the leg side
excellent tight delivery on middle stump. Shah's forward, smothering
nicely played off his pads and he's paced that beautifully for two
straight, flicked off his pads - Shah looks like he's got his feet into a tangle as he made his ground. And yes, replays confirm the tangle was entirely of his own doing. Winner
down the leg side
has he dropped him, the bowler? Yes! A ferociously smacked drive and he can't cling on
somehow Shah isn't bowled! Opened up all three stumps in a slog-sweep but missed the ball completely

pushed out to the off side, Shah sets off for a single without considering he has a batting partner at the other end, and has to dive back into ground. The throw's good, but it's not a direct hit and, thus, dear readers, he is home
how has that not bowled him? A quicker top-spinner which bamboozles Shah completely, the ball rushing over his stumps
and the googly rushes onto Pietersen, this time, who looks horribly late on this chopping shot. Hit on the back leg, but outside oeg
powerfully pulled and fine leg nearly makes a complete mess of it
defended back to the bowler. Afridi threatens to decapitate Shah with a ghosted throw, and Pietersen's chuckling at the other end. All fun and games
oh shot. Inside-out, hugely poweful cover-drive for four. Immense strength!
swept to square leg
Shah's second four, slog-sweeping between the two men on the leg side. Excellent, urgent strokeplay
spins back sharply on Shah
tickled off his toes to square leg. Kamran Akmal is going to be hoarse by tomorrow - screaming his throat off out there.
swept to short fine leg
Shah takes a step down the pitch but is rapped on the pads. Too fast for him
excellent shot! Swept hard behind square for four.
Shah steps outside leg and chops it to mid-off
that's out - out of the ground! A big sweep by Pietersen and I thought he'd miscued it, but oh no. That's six all the way
ooh shot once more - well wide and he did well to reach it, slapping it to wide long-off. Shah's too slow to get two...
flicked to leg
a short-arm jab - Shah thinks this is going for four and is only walking the first run. Poor cricket - he really must be more aware
goes for a slap over midwicket but misses
he's timed that. Yes, he's timed the socks off that! A short-arm jab with massive amounts of bottom hand, bunted massively over wide long-on. Huge!
back cut to third man
Pietersen walks into a drive but mistimes it
another monster from Pietersen, this time driving inside-out over extra cover! Wow - that really was a massive flump!
starts with a straight slower ball
got him! A much quicker delivery at 86mph beats Shah's attempted pull, the ball shooting low and smashing his stumps. Gone!
straight delivery worked to mid-on
a bouncer - KP leaves it alone ... and eventually it's called a wide on height, much to the cheering delight of the England fans
fast ball but on his legs and Pietersen whips to leg. The crowd all cheer for his fifty, but it's a leg-bye! And they boo. Great, pantomime atmosphere here
nudged down to long-on
a thick inside edge past the stumps to bring up his fifty. Top knock! 31 balls
worked through midwicket
goes for a sweep but misses
that's well bowled - much much faster, as he saw KP charging him. Great ball in fact
down the pitch, Collingwood flips him to square leg but just for a single
driven back to the bowler - excellent, tight, economical over
dropped at square leg, diving forward to collect this flicky shot off his toes. Tricky chance but Arafat really ought to have swallowed that
Collingwood pulls muscularly and it fairly races away - I didn't think he'd timed it, but that shows how much I know
a full toss bunged through the leg side - four more! Collingwood's timing is spot on tonight
angled behind square
ooh fine delivery, another Gul yorker on the off stump and Pietersen can only squeeze it out to the off side for a single
a full toss on his legs and it beats his pull
got him! Afridi takes a simple catch as Collingwood tries to smite him over the top but can only sky it to long-off
timed to cover - they set off for a quick single and in comes the throw to the wicketkeeper but I think Mascarenhas is in. Direct hit would've been tasty
pushed out to the off side
stands tall, working it off his hip for a well-run two
done by the doosra! Goes for a massive shot but gets a thick outside edge to short third man!
nudged to leg
cracked out to mid-off
ooh, beaten by a corker which cuts back into him!
dropped by Saeed at short fine leg - a little paddly sweep by Foster
Mascarenhas tries to bash a four over the top but whacks it into his foot...
flicked to leg
full and straight, worked to leg - excellent tight over
flogged over midwicket for four - much too short from Afridi
short of a length and again flinged over the leg side, but for two this time - good running
seriously quick - 79mph!
carved out to long-off - another very quick ball
a back-foot smash for six - what on earth's going on? He stepped to leg and gave himself room, flinging it over extra cover for six - what a shot!
a similar shot winging its way short of long-off this time
yorker, bashed out to cover
another yorker but he squeezes it out cleverly to the off side
bashed back to the bowler - this'll be run out. No! Mucked it up! He's bounced it straight over the stumps!
flayed over point and Salman Butt at deep cover point....drops it! And he's fumbled it while trying to pick it up, too!
really full, forced out to the off side
squeezed out to the off side, Gul fields and again wangs in a throw which misses the stumps by a country mile! Overthrows for England
